dialogue.text: Hey...
Hey...You...
Wake... Now...
Hey wake up!
You there! you need to wake up now!
options: What's going on? who are you? where am I?

dialogue.text: Let's mingle later, you need to stand up now or we're both done for good!
Finally! that orc has been staring at us, you need to do something quick.
options: Orc? what orc? I can't see anything!

dialogue.text: What? Careful! It's charging!
We won't hold long like this, go back!
options: I can't see anything what is going on!?

dialogue.text: I don't know! But what I do know is that, if we stay here, we're both going to die!
Good... we lost it.
You sure are a pain!
options: Listen- I don't know who you are, where you are, where I am. And I can't see anything. What have you done to me?

dialogue.text: You should be thanking me, I saved you in there, twice!
That orc would've eaten us alive!
options: Well why didn't you do anything, there's clearly something wrong with me!

dialogue.text: I would've if you were actually dead!
I can't use your body if there's already another soul inside!
I don't even remember where my body is, I've been roaming for an eternity.
options: What do you mean? What are you? Why would you use my body?

dialogue.text: I'm a roaming soul, it's a curse that was put on my soul. I don't remember why.
Once our body dies, we're forced to roam mindlessly until we manage to find another vessel. It's a painfully boring process. Like insomnia, but for thousands of years.
Usually, we're attracted to dead vessels, we can't occupy vessels which are already occupied by another soul.
I guess you were for a short while, but happened to come back to life...
options: Great... So now we're sharing a body...

dialogue.text: Hey, I didn't choose it either, roaming souls are unconscious during the 'roaming' part. My soul chose your vessel, that's all.
options: So what do we do now? And why can't I see anything?

dialogue.text: I don't know, you seem to have been blinded, maybe a near fatal wound that's why I was able to occupy your body.
Since I'm not entirely occupying your body, I seem to be able to see just fine, I'll help you navigate...
options: Let's go figure out a way to get my eyes fixed then!

dialogue.text: ... If you help me.
options: This is my body, you're the intruder, you're the one who owes me, not the other way around.

dialogue.text: No matter how you see it, you won't be able to do anything without me, your choice.
I want to end my curse.
I don't know
I've heard that, at the bottom of the dungeon, there's an artefact who can grant you any wish, anything you desire.
Yes, beyond what the mind can comprehend, beyond everything we've ever known.
options: You don't know how to get there do you?

dialogue.text: No one's ever been there yet, as far as I know, the deepest anyone has ever been is the 7th layer I believe.
options: The 7th layer? what even is this dungeon?

dialogue.text: Do you not know? It's the central point of this land. You must've suffered a violent shock since you don't seem to know a lot...
options: I guess so... I don't remember... Anything actually.

dialogue.text: I seem to have a vast knowledge about this place, maybe my original body was some kind of adventurer. I can guide you, you'll have to trust me.
options: If I die, what happens to you?

dialogue.text: My soul is still affected by the curse, I'll go back to roaming for eternity. I'd like to avoid that
options: I guess I can trust you.

dialogue.text: Great, I remember a few things that could be of help to us, artefacts that can help a blind man like you.
options: artefacts, like the one that grants wishes?

dialogue.text: Yes, there's a lot of them, ranging from common to incredibly rare. The rarer it is, the more power it holds. The more expensive it sells too.
You need to be very careful with artefacts, some have locked up people in an eternity of torture. They can be unpredictable.
I'll describe everything I can see in as much details as I can...
We'll start by finding a merchant who can get us the useful artefacts I told you about. Pick up your bag.
To your right...
Let's get going.
